instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3588: What is 820-3588? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message:
Clean board, no shorts found on any of the rails from page 100.

All test are done with board alone and PS set up at 12.2V like I always test this boards, with iMac PS does the same thing.

Already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>.

I have steady <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>

Not sure what else to check.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message: Did you set PSU amp limit to max first?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message: Yes and all the donor parts are coming from a working board that I was able to power on with PSU

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is really stable, first LED can't blink; it is driven directly from <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message: First LED is steady green, it blinks only when power button is pressed or if power on pads are shorted.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3588</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> First LED blinks after power button press
threads.message:
You've said steady <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>; seems not, probably didn't note drop pulse.
Should be good to use o-scope to monitor <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL> also, at same time.
